articles.title: Elon Reveals the Exact xAI Data Center Compute and Predicts Superintelligence
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Elon has revealed the exact amount of compute used to train Grok 3.5 and predicts superintelligence could happen this year or in 2026. There will be about ten deep intelligences made and four of them will be in the United States. Brian Wang is a Futurist Thought Leader and a popular Science blogger with 1 million readers per month.

articles.title: Campaign ad utilizes artificial intelligence
articles.summary: Kim Varet is running in the Democratic primary in California's 40th congressional district to try to unseat Rep. Young Kim, R-Calif., next fall. She created a campaign ad using fake people created by artificial intelligence. Congress has done little to regulate artificial intelligence and the president's agenda would limit the ability for states to regulate AI.

articles.title: Campaign ad utilizes artificial intelligence, prompting the question: What impact will AI have on the 2026 election?
articles.author: Cassie Semyon
articles.summary: Esther Kim Varet's campaign ad has gotten national attention for its ingenuity using AI. She is running in the Democratic primary in California's 40th congressional district to try to unseat Rep. Young Kim, R-Calif., next fall. The ability to pump out an ad so quickly and with a phone or laptop means voters will likely see more campaign ads created with AI in the near future. Congress has done little to regulate artificial intelligence. A bipartisan group of lawmakers have introduced the Protect Elections from Deceptive AI Act, but it hasn't gained any traction.

articles.title: Verizon AI Shopper: Unwanted Charges & Customer Rip-Off?
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Verizon's AI assistant, Personal Shopper, is a case study in customer service problems with artificial intelligence in telecoms. The problems with Verizon's AI are a symptom of a trend of companies prioritizing profit maximization over user experience. Companies should focus on making the customer experience as simple and transparent as possible.

articles.title: CapCut AI: Stunning Videos Without Editing Skills
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: CapCut has introduced a suite of AI-powered tools that are redefining video editing. CapCut's AI media tools are designed to make visual storytelling more accessible and intuitive, empowering users to bring their ideas to life with minimal effort. The tools save time and enhance overall content quality, making the editing process more efficient.

articles.title: Intel reveals plans to lay off thousands of workers
articles.author: Bob Unruh
articles.summary: Intel will lay off up to 20% of its factory workers. The company reported a loss of $821 million during the first quarter of the year. It is the second round of layoffs at Intel in just a year, after last winter's 15%. The company troubles are because of upstart competitors, compounding financial losses and declining stock price.

articles.title: Do AI tools undermine our sense of creativity? New study says yes
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: People tend to feel less creative when using artificial intelligence tools, according to a new study published in The Journal of Creative Behavior. The research highlights how beliefs affect people's creative activities.       .   "In order to achieve a creative result, it's necessary to engage in creative activities"

articles.title: Friday's Horoscope: Health, Love & Work Predictions (June 20)
articles.author: Marina Collins
articles.summary: In the future, horoscopes and personal insights are going to revolutionize how we approach health, love, and work. The focus is shifting beyond surface-level predictions about love or money. Horoscopes will focus on the core of who you are and help you understand your emotional patterns.

articles.title: MarketBeat declares Summer of AI, launches tools to empower investors
articles.author: Submitted
articles.summary: This summer, MarketBeat is integrating AI across its platform, from simplifying earnings calls to generating personalized watchlist summaries. The next phase of AI development at MarketBeat will emphasize personalization and relevance. New features will be designed to deliver the right information at the right time.

articles.title: Superintelligence in 2026 or 2032
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Dwarkesh is bullish on AI over the long-term. He expects AI data center compute scaling to slow down within 4 years, but it could scale by 50X with 10X the chips and 5X better chips by the first half of 2026 with one million B200 or B300s.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Environmental Impact: Use AI Responsibly
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Training a single large language model can emit as much carbon as five cars do throughout their lifetimes. Data centers are the engines of the AI revolution, but they pose a significant challenge for green AI. Individual users and organizations can take steps to lessen the environmental impact of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: 19 People Becoming Billionaires In The AI Boom
articles.author: Nicholas Morine
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is perhaps the most significant technological step forward since the introduction and proliferation of social media networks and ecommerce platforms. The rapid rise of AI models has led to a massive creation of capital. The most prominent new billionaires to profit from the AI boom are Alexandr Wang, Alex Pichai and Wenfeng.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO accuses Meta of offering $100 million bonuses to poach employees
articles.author: Sophia Compton
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman claims Meta tried to recruit employees from his company by offering them $100 million bonuses. Meta is investing $65 billion into AI in 2025, including the construction of a massive data center. Mark Zuckerberg is building a superintelligence team from a group of artificial intelligence researchers and engineers.

articles.title: Disable Google AI Overviews: A Guide
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Google prioritizes AI Overviews over traditional snippets in search results. The author argues that this change negatively impacts content creators and Google itself by reducing ad clicks and revenue. There is no official way to permanently remove AI overviews, but the author suggests using the 'Web' content filter as a temporary workaround.

articles.title: ChatGPT & the Planet: Use AI Responsibly (Washington Post)
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: A single training run of a large language model can emit as much carbon as five cars in their lifetimes. The energy demands of training and running complex AI models are significant, especially for those in the field of AI like OpenAI's ChatGPT. Data centers house the powerful servers needed to process and store massive datasets. According to a report by the University of Cambridge, the carbon footprint of AI is set to increase exponentially over the next decade unless proactive measures are taken to decrease its energy use.

articles.title: ACI Infotech Accelerates Growth with Exclusive Salesforce-Agentforce Partnership and Bold Vision for the Future

articles.author: Nauman khan

Johny Srouji, senior vice president of hardware technologies at Apple, discussed the company's approach during a speech in Belgium last month. Apple has relied on its custom silicon since 2010 and shifted its Mac lineup from Intel processors in 2020. Apple offers limited updates on its AI strategy at its June Worldwide Developers Conference.

articles.title: Cisco's AI Revolution: Re-Tooling for the Future
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: The rise of AI has triggered a new 'gold rush' in the form of data centers. Companies are building ultra-fast networks and advanced hardware to meet the critical need for speed and low latency. Cisco is positioning itself as a vital enabler of AI.

articles.title: Many are turning to AI to escape from repetitive tasks in the workplace, new study reveals
articles.author: SWNS
articles.summary: American workers' productivity peaks at 11 a.m. on Mondays, according to a survey of 2,000 knowledge workers commissioned by Grammarly and administered by Talker Research. They have an average of 53 tasks per week that ruin their productive momentum. This leads to over three and a half hours of 'lost productivity' per week. Less than half of respondents' companies have a clear AI policy, but 76% believe AI will be essential in corporate jobs in the future.

articles.title: The Greatest Story Never Written
articles.author: Eric Francis Coppolino
articles.summary: In 2020, the world will be even more digitized and people will lose their sense of smell and taste. The collapse of identity makes people and countries aggressive under digital conditions. Sam Altman has said that a significant fraction of the world's electricity should go to powering AI. Both Meta and Microsoft have entered nuclear power deals with energy providers.

articles.author: Michael Kaltschnee
articles.summary: Connecticut legislature passed an AI regulation bill in late May after trimming it down to avoid a veto from Gov. Ned Lamont. He's concerned about AI's potential to stifle creativity and scare off innovators. Michael Kaltschnee is an entrepreneur and co-director of the Danbury Hackerspace. He thinks the governor should veto the bill unless the AI ban is removed.

articles.summary: The guy who programmed the Boston Red Sox AI bot has been conducting interviews on behalf of the team for a baseball operations job role. articles.title: ADMA Biologics (ADMA) Drops for 5th Consecutive Day – Here's Why
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros

ADMA is an independent distributor in their pharmacy.

articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) declined by 4.46 percent on Wednesday to close at $344.37 apiece. The company was not included in the S&P 500 index. Bank of America and Barclays both expressed confidence it will join the index's recent rebalancing.

articles.title: Bitdeer Technologies (BTDR) Falls 7% After $330-Million Debt Offer
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Bitdeer Technologies Group (NASDAQ:BTDR) is one of the worst-performing stocks on Thursday. articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Symbotic Inc. (NASDAQ:SYM) surged by 14.57 percent on Wednesday to close at $35.70 apiece. Amazon CEO Andrew Jassy wrote to employees about the company's increasing adoption of Artificial Intelligence. Symbotic is heavily focused on warehouse automation and robotics.

Advanced AI models produce more CO2 emissions when they use reasoning to generate long, complex responses. Generative AI models now use as much electricity annually as entire countries. All the companies praised AI for its efficiency in data analysis, making it easier to judge and comb through internal tests and statistics for any company's respective product or consumer data.

It stresses transparency-focused regulations such as whistleblower protections and audits by independent third-parties. It also highlights how AI has changed in the past three months, including improvements in its ability to act independently and to help people make dangerous weapons.

articles.title: Gov. Gavin Newsom's new AI report aims to reign in potential cyber-dangers
articles.author: Khari Johnson
articles.summary: The report stresses transparency-focused regulations such as whistleblower protections and audits by independent third-parties. It also highlights a language model from the AI company Anthropic as an example of an immediate risk. The report does not address a number of issues the California Legislature is considering.

articles.author: Brian Burns

Google stands to lose massive amounts of revenue from the ad revenue shares it previously garnered from these highly trafficked news sites.

articles.summary: New research report from Automation Anywhere and Forrester Consulting reveals key barriers and breakthroughs shaping enterprise adoption of AI agents. 60% of respondents believe automation platforms are the most valuable foundation for managing AI-driven processes. 71% agreed that automation solutions should augment human capabilities rather than replace them. 75% of leaders plan to pilot AI agents for customer support within the next year.

articles.summary: A new study shows that more complex AI models produce more CO2 emissions than simpler ones. Researchers urge people to be more mindful of the environmental impact of their AI systems and choose the right model for their needs. The most accurate model, Cogito (70 billion parameters), produced three times more Co2 than similar sized models that provided Concise Answers (72 billion parameters).

The New York Artificial Intelligence Act requires companies to disclose when they use AI tools in high-stakes decision-making processes. The Automated Decision-Making Systems in Government Act requires that automated systems used by state agencies undergo regular impact assessments and include meaningful human oversight.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Market Size Worth USD 3,680.47 Bn By 2034
articles.author: Precedence Research
articles.summary: According to Precedence Research, the global artificial intelligence market size is expected to be worth $3,680.47 billion by 2034. North America led the global AI market in 2024, capturing over 36.92% of the total market share. Deep learning technology dominated the AI space in 2024. The services segment emerged as the leading solution category, contributing more than 39.2%. BFSI sector held a significant 17.4% share of the AI market.

articles.title: Will Congress block state's AI rules?
articles.author: STEVE BRAWNER
articles.summary: Arkansas state lawmakers this year passed a number of laws related to artificial intelligence. If the U.S. Senate passes the House version of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act, the state may not be able to enforce them. The bill prohibits states and other political subdivisions from limiting, restricting or regulating artificial intelligence models, artificial intelligence systems, or automated decision systems entered into interstate commerce.

articles.title: Larry Magid: Using ChatGPT for everyday tasks
